title: No counterspace
content:
hello,   
anyone know of a source to aquire a font that all of the counterspaces filled in???   
sort of like what comedy central has been using.   
   
thanks,   
-mike
author: at_zero

comments.content:
If it's of any help, the font they're using here (taken from comedycentral.com) is Font Bureau's Garage Gothic, with the counters filled in.   
   
 ![nocounters.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110140641im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/37039.gif)   
   
For short batches of text, it would be pretty simple to set the type in Illustrator/Corel/Quark/InDesign, convert it to outlines, and start deleting bezier points.
